abstract: The offshoot of Torrisi Italian Specialties opens Nov. 7. Torrisi will have $125 prix fixe with reservations.
snippet: The offshoot of Torrisi Italian Specialties opens Nov. 7. Torrisi will have $125 prix fixe with reservations.
lead_paragraph: This offshoot of Torrisi Italian Specialties, opening on Nov. 7, taps the same Italian-American vein as the parent restaurant, but in a more familiar way. The new place, done with cute retro wallpaper, will serve chicken francese, baked ziti, garlic bread, an "Italian Thanksgiving" turkey dinner and sandwiches or platters of eggplant parm and meatball parm, refined in the hands of the chef-partners, Mario Carbone and Rich Torrisi. It will have a small takeout counter in the front, seats at the bar (a full bar this time), and tables for 30 in back.

headline.main: Parm, the Torrisi Spinoff, Opens in Days
